Description: Ostracon, large section of the upper-body of a brown pottery jar with ribbed body, cylindrical neck and one handle surviving, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of large red-painted Coptic characters.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394148) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394148)
